name: Massimo Donelli
content: Massimo Donelli | CV | University of Trento Massimo Donelli Associate professor Department of Civil, Environmental and Mechanical Engineering Via Mesiano, 77 - 38123 Trento tel. 0461 282063 massimo.donelli[at]unitn [dot] it Expertise: Biomedical imaging Coding theory Cryptography Electromagnetic inverse scattering Evolutionary algorithms Information & Communication Technology (ICT) Optimization Pattern recognition Radars Radio communication Satellite communication Software-defined radio Unmanned aerial vehicle Wireless networks Wireless power transmission Education First Professional Degree High School Degree in Industrial Electronic from the Industrial Technical Institute “Italo Calvino”, Genova Sestri Ponente, Italy 1990/1991 (Grade 60/60). Master Master Degree in Electronic Engineering from the University of Genoa, Italy Thesis discussed on December 22th, 1998 (Grade 103/110), on "Spice Electromagnetic Models for the Interactions between External Electromagnetic Field and Multi-conductors Transmission Lines" (“Modelli Elettromagnetici per Simulazione Spice dell’Interazione tra Campi Elettromagnetici Esterni e Linee Multiconduttore”) Supervisor: Prof. Matteo Pastorino. National Licensing Exam National Licensing Exam for Electronic Engineers obtained on July 1999 (Grade 247/260). Doctorate/Ph.D.    Ph.D. in Science and Space Engineering from the Doctoral School of the University of Genoa (Italy). Thesis discussed on June 2003, on ”Methods and Measurements System for Electromagnetic Compatibility in Spatial Application“. Post Doctorate Post Doctorate in Telecommunication from the University of Trento (Italy) March 2003 (two years) on “Propagation models for WLAN communications”, supervisors Prof. R. Battiti and Prof. A. Massa. Academic Position Assistant Professor of electromagnetic field at the Department of Information Engineering and Computer Science of the University of Trento March 2005. Present Occupation From October 2014, Massimo Donelli is an Associate Professor of electromagnetic field at the Department of Information Engineering and Computer Science of the University of Trento. Academic career and teaching activities 3.
